answers.author: Elisabeth Berman
answers.text:
Here is my dog Jackson - rescued a year ago from York County SPCA in Pennsylvania. He's half boxer, half bulldog and blissfully unaware of anything except his blanket, large sticks and eating paper towel rolls.

Katie appeared to have been dropped off on the side of the road when we found her in 2005. She was alone, injured, and only about six weeks old. She stole our hearts before we could make it to the shelter.

answers.text:
Madison, on the other hand, has been with me 13 years now.  She was part of litter that was exposed to palsy in utro.  I waited nearly a month and a half before they'd allow me to adopt her because the shelter staff wanted to make sure she'd survive

We brought these beauties home after months at the rescue league.  They told us that black and white cats are considered unadoptable because no one wants them.  Jesse, Jake, Chance, and Della (two sets of littermates adopted as adults) are the nicest kitties!


We brought these beauties home after months at the rescue league.  They told us that black and white cats are considered unadoptable because no one wants them.  Jesse, Jake, Chance, and Della (two sets of littermates adopted as adults) are the nicest kitties!

answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
This is Abigail.  Abi is a 3 1/2 year old Poochon (Poodle-Bichon Frise mix) we adopted from the Fairfax County Animal Shelter in Fairfax, VA.  She was particularly important to us because she helped to fill a very empty space in our home after our daughter went away to college.  Abi is one of the smartest dogs I've ever met.  She loves to get up on her hind legs and dance or simply to try to get a better view of things.


This is Abigail.  Abi is a 3 1/2 year old Poochon (Poodle-Bichon Frise mix) we adopted from the Fairfax County Animal Shelter in Fairfax, VA.  She was particularly important to us because she helped to fill a very empty space in our home after our daughter went away to college.  Abi is one of the smartest dogs I've ever met.  She loves to get up on her hind legs and dance or simply to try to get a better view of things.

answers.text:
Sasha the Schnoodle was adopted 4 years ago. She's particularly fond of watching educational television. (Yes! I have videos of her watching TV.) She particularly enjoyed "The Life of Mammals" the other night. She's very smart, very busy, and very stubborn. And delightful!

author: Rick Aronhalt
text:
Have a photogenic pooch or fabulous feline that you've rescued? ICMA needs your photos to help create the Oct. 9 webinar: Innovations in Animal Rescue and Care. We'll be featuring the city of San Antonio, Texas, and sharing best practices that helped them turn a failing program into a model for local government.
Please upload your jpg in the comments of this question. By doing so, you agree that ICMA may use these photos for the production of this webinar and for the On Demand version that follows. You also agree that Fido will waive all royalties for the use of his likeness.
To register for this event, visit here: http://learning.icma.org/store/seminar/seminar.php?seminar=21701&pc=kn
title: Shelter Pet Photos Wanted
